Body:
I would like to know if there is a system for classifying the types of questions that can be asked in languages. In other words, how are sentences that query the why, where, what, who, when, and how classified? I guess whence, whither, etc. also belong in that list.

Additionally, what is the term for questions that query "ordinality"? For example,

Q: [What number] president was George Washington?

A: The first.

Q: [What number] son of your father are you?

A: The second.

AFAIK, there is no construct to ask such a question in English. But there is in languages belonging to other families.

Are there any references on the distribution of these question types across languages?
Title: Types of questions and questioning "ordinality"
